ScoriaPy
  • API reference
  • View page source

API reference

This section documents the public API of the scoriapy package. The modules below are organized following the Scanpy convention.

Preprocessing (scoriapy.pp)

scoriapy.pp.read_10x_h5_concat(samples, sample_info)

Read multiple 10x HDF5 matrices and concatenate them into one AnnData.

Parameters:

  • samples (Iterable[Tuple[str, Path]]) – Iterable of (sample_name, path_to_filtered_feature_bc_matrix.h5).

  • sample_info (DataFrame) – DataFrame indexed by sample_name that contains at least a "treatment" column (additional columns are kept in the index and can be joined later if needed).

Returns:

Concatenated object with sample_name and treatment in .obs.

Return type:

AnnData

scoriapy.pp.read_10x_mtx_concat(main_folder_path, batch_key='batch')

Read 10x MTX folders inside main_folder_path and concatenate them.

Each direct subdirectory is assumed to contain a matrix in 10x MTX format.

Parameters:

  • main_folder_path (Path | str) – Path to the main folder containing subfolders with 10x MTX data.

  • batch_key (str) – Name of the column in .obs indicating the batch/subfolder.

Returns:

Concatenated object with batches annotated by batch_key.

Return type:

AnnData

scoriapy.pp.run_hvg(adata, n_top=3000, flavor='seurat', log=None)

Compute and subset highly variable genes (HVGs).

This is a thin wrapper around scanpy.pp.highly_variable_genes() that logs progress and returns a view restricted to the selected genes.

Parameters:

  • adata – Input AnnData object.

  • n_top (int) – Number of highly variable genes to keep.

  • flavor (str) – HVG selection flavor passed to Scanpy (e.g. "seurat").

  • log – Optional logging.Logger instance. If None, a default scoriapy logger is created.

Returns:

Copy of adata restricted to the selected HVGs.

Return type:

AnnData

Analysis tools (scoriapy.tl)

scoriapy.tl.aggregate_group_expression(adata, group_mask, group_name)

Aggregate gene expression for a specific group.

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object with expression data.

  • group_mask – Index or boolean mask selecting cells belonging to the group.

  • group_name (str) – Name to use for the aggregated pseudo-bulk sample.

Returns:

Single-column DataFrame indexed by gene names.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

scoriapy.tl.aggregate_single_cell_data(adata, group_cols)

Aggregate single-cell expression data by the given group columns.

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object with expression data.

  • group_cols (List[str]) – List of obs columns to group by (e.g. ["sample", "cell_type"]).

Returns:

Pseudo-bulk expression matrix with groups as columns.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

scoriapy.tl.check_group_columns_exist(adata, group_cols)

Ensure that all requested grouping columns exist in adata.obs.

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object whose obs will be checked.

  • group_cols (List[str]) – List of column names that must be present in adata.obs.

Raises:

ValueError – If any of the requested columns are missing.

Return type:

None

scoriapy.tl.combine_group_values(group_values)

Combine group column values into a single string, separated by underscores.

Parameters:

group_values – Iterable of values describing a group.

Returns:

Combined group name.

Return type:

str

scoriapy.tl.compare_cluster_phase(cross_table, cluster_id, level=0, group_level='age')

Apply a Kruskal-Wallis test to each phase for a given cluster.

Parameters:

  • cross_table (DataFrame) – Cross-tabulated table (e.g. from pandas.crosstab()) whose index includes the cluster identifier.

  • cluster_id (str) – Specific cluster label to analyze.

  • level (int) – Level of the index in cross_table corresponding to cluster_id.

  • group_level (str) – Index level used to define groups for the test (e.g. "age").

Returns:

Mapping from phase (e.g. "G1", "G2M", "S") to Kruskal-Wallis test results.

Return type:

dict

scoriapy.tl.compare_gene_expression(adata, clustering_key, cluster_ids, gene, groupby_col)

Compare expression of a single gene across multiple groups with Kruskal-Wallis.

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – AnnData object with expression data.

  • clustering_key (str) – Column in adata.obs used to subset to specific clusters.

  • cluster_ids – One or more cluster identifiers to include.

  • gene (str) – Gene name to test.

  • groupby_col (str) – Column in adata.obs defining the groups to compare.

Returns:

Dunn’s test results as a DataFrame if the global test is significant, otherwise None.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame or None

scoriapy.tl.compare_gene_expression_two(adata, clustering_key, cluster_ids, gene, groupby_col)

Compare expression of a single gene between exactly two groups using Mann-Whitney U.

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – AnnData object with expression data.

  • clustering_key (str) – Column in adata.obs used to subset to specific clusters.

  • cluster_ids – One or more cluster identifiers to include.

  • gene (str) – Gene name to test.

  • groupby_col (str) – Column in adata.obs defining the two groups being compared.

Returns:

Dictionary with keys "gene", "statistic", and "p_value".

Return type:

dict

scoriapy.tl.create_group_dicts(adata, group_cols)

Create a list of dictionaries defining groups based on specified columns.

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object whose obs is used to define groups.

  • group_cols (List[str]) – List of column names to group by.

Returns:

List of dictionaries describing each group combination.

Return type:

list of dict

scoriapy.tl.detect_gene_flips(one_down, one_up, two_down, two_up, return_df=True)

Identify genes that flip direction between two conditions.

Parameters:

  • one_down (List[str]) – Gene lists for the two conditions.

  • one_up (List[str]) – Gene lists for the two conditions.

  • two_down (List[str]) – Gene lists for the two conditions.

  • two_up (List[str]) – Gene lists for the two conditions.

  • return_df (bool) – If True, return a DataFrame, otherwise a dict.

scoriapy.tl.get_de_genes(adata, group_col='age', key='rank_genes_groups', query=None)

Extract sets of differentially expressed genes for each group.

Assumes that differential expression results are already present in adata.uns[key] as created by scanpy.tl.rank_genes_groups().

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – AnnData object with DE results.

  • group_col (str) – Column in adata.obs that defines the groups.

  • key (str) – Key under which DE results are stored in adata.uns.

  • query (str | None) – Optional pandas query string to filter the DE table for each group.

Returns:

Mapping from group label to a set of gene names.

Return type:

dict

scoriapy.tl.get_deg_df(adata, cluster_key, groupby_attribute, rank_key, query)

Compute a DEG table for a given query and return expression for selected genes.

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – AnnData object with expression data.

  • cluster_key (str) – Column in adata.obs indicating clusters (currently not used in the implementation but kept for API compatibility).

  • groupby_attribute (str) – Column in adata.obs used for grouping in DE analysis.

  • rank_key (str) – Key under which to store DE results in adata.uns.

  • query (str) – Pandas query string used to filter the DE table.

Returns:

  • test_df – Expression matrix (genes x cells) for the selected genes.

  • filter_df – DataFrame with statistics for the selected genes.

Return type:

Tuple[DataFrame, DataFrame]

scoriapy.tl.get_pairwise_deg(adata, comparisons, groupby_col='group', method='wilcoxon')

Perform pairwise differential expression analysis for specified comparisons.

This is a convenience wrapper around scanpy.tl.rank_genes_groups().

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – AnnData object with expression data.

  • comparisons (Iterable[Tuple[str, str]]) – Iterable of pairs (group1, group2) to compare.

  • groupby_col (str) – Column in adata.obs used for grouping.

  • method (str) – Differential expression method passed to Scanpy (e.g. "wilcoxon").

Returns:

Mapping from comparison label (e.g. "A_vs_B") to a pandas.DataFrame of DE statistics.

Return type:

dict

scoriapy.tl.run_rank_genes_groups(adata, groupby_attribute, rank_key=None)

Run scanpy.tl.rank_genes_groups() and plot the result.

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – AnnData object with expression data.

  • groupby_attribute (str) – Column in adata.obs used to define groups.

  • rank_key (str | None) – Optional key under which to store results in adata.uns. If None, defaults to f"{groupby_attribute}_rank".

Return type:

None

scoriapy.tl.summarize_category_distribution(adata, category_col, group_col, selected_groups=None, normalize=False, sort_order=None)

Summarize the distribution of a categorical variable across groups.

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object containing the relevant categorical data in obs.

  • category_col (str) – Name of the column in obs whose distribution is summarized.

  • group_col – Column name or list of column names in obs defining groups.

  • selected_groups (list[str] | None) – Optional list of column-prefixes to keep (e.g. ["Y", "M", "O"]).

  • normalize (bool) – If True, express counts as percentages per column and add a "Total" row.

  • sort_order (list[str] | None) – Optional list defining the ordering of group prefixes.

Returns:

When normalize is True, returns a styled percentage table; otherwise a styled count table with an extra "Total" column.

Return type:

pandas.io.formats.style.Styler or pandas.DataFrame

Plotting (scoriapy.pl)

scoriapy.pl.add_text_labels(ax, median_positions, text_props_kw=None)

Add text labels at median positions on a matplotlib Axes.

Parameters:

  • ax – Target matplotlib Axes.

  • median_positions – Mapping from label to (x, y) coordinate.

  • text_props_kw (dict | None) – Optional dict of keyword arguments forwarded to ax.text.

scoriapy.pl.calculate_median_position(adata_subset, basis, overlay_attribute)

Calculate median positions of clusters in an embedding.

Parameters:

  • adata_subset – AnnData object with an embedding in .obsm[basis].

  • basis (str) – Key of the embedding in adata_subset.obsm.

  • overlay_attribute (str) – Observation column defining the groups whose medians are computed.

Returns:

Mapping from label to a 2D median coordinate.

Return type:

dict

scoriapy.pl.create_heatmap_annotation(col_df)

Create a PyComplexHeatmap.HeatmapAnnotation from a column DataFrame.

Parameters:

col_df (DataFrame) – Column annotation DataFrame whose columns will be turned into annotation tracks.

Returns:

Configured annotation object.

Return type:

PyComplexHeatmap.HeatmapAnnotation

scoriapy.pl.get_heatmap_dfs(adata, obs_cols, var_cols, scale=False)

Prepare matrices and annotation DataFrames for heatmap plotting.

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – AnnData object with expression data.

  • obs_cols (List[str]) – List of observation columns to include as column annotations.

  • var_cols (List[str]) – List of variable columns to include as row annotations.

  • scale (bool) – If True, z-score rows of the expression matrix.

Returns:

Dictionary with keys "df_mat", "col_df", and "row_df".

Return type:

dict

scoriapy.pl.plot_cluster_heatmap(df_mat, col_df, row_df, figsize=(15, 15), **kwargs)

Plot a clustered heatmap with annotations for genes and cells.

Parameters:

  • df_mat (DataFrame) – Expression matrix (rows = genes, columns = cells).

  • col_df (DataFrame) – Column annotation DataFrame (index should align with columns of df_mat).

  • row_df (DataFrame) – Row annotation DataFrame (index should align with rows of df_mat and include a "gene_cat" column).

  • figsize (tuple[int, int]) – Size of the matplotlib figure.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments forwarded to PyComplexHeatmap.ClusterMapPlotter.

scoriapy.pl.plot_distribution(df, n=1000, x_intercept=-1.5)

Plot a KDE of values in df with an optional vertical cutoff line.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – DataFrame whose numeric values to visualize.

  • n (int) – Maximum number of columns to sample for plotting.

  • x_intercept (float) – Location of the vertical reference line.

scoriapy.pl.plot_embeddings_with_labels(adata, basis, color_attribute, overlay_attribute, group_col=None, subplot_width=5, text_props_kw=None)

Plot embeddings with median-position labels, optionally split by a grouping column.

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object with an embedding in .obsm[basis].

  • basis (str) – Key in adata.obsm for the embedding (e.g. "X_umap").

  • color_attribute (str) – Observation column used to color cells.

  • overlay_attribute (str) – Observation column used to define label groups.

  • group_col (str | None) – Optional column in adata.obs used to split the data into separate subplots.

  • subplot_width (float) – Base width of each subplot (in inches).

  • text_props_kw (dict | None) – Optional dict of keyword arguments forwarded to ax.text.

scoriapy.pl.plot_group_embeddings(adata, group_col, color, basis='X_pca_umap', **kwargs)

Create embedding plots for each group in group_col.

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object with an embedding in .obsm[basis].

  • group_col (str) – Column in adata.obs used to define groups.

  • color (str) – Observation column used to color cells.

  • basis (str) – Key in adata.obsm containing the embedding coordinates.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments forwarded to scanpy.pl.embedding().

scoriapy.pl.plot_pca_for_samples(adata, sample_list)

Plot PCA embeddings for a list of sample IDs.

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object containing a "sample" column in obs.

  • sample_list – Iterable of sample IDs to visualize.

scoriapy.pl.plot_umap_by_categories(adata, obs_columns, basis='X_umap', color='leiden', ncol=3, figsize=(15, 5), sort_order=None, cluster_to_cell_mapping=None, legend_location='on_data', point_size=None)

Plot UMAPs for each combination of categories in obs_columns.

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object containing an embedding in .obsm[basis].

  • obs_columns (Sequence[str]) – Sequence of observation columns whose unique combinations define subplots (e.g. ["age", "sample"]).

  • basis (str) – Key in adata.obsm containing the embedding coordinates.

  • color (str) – Observation column used to color cells (e.g. "leiden").

  • ncol (int) – Number of subplots per row.

  • figsize (tuple[int, int]) – Base figure size; actual height scales with the number of rows.

  • sort_order (Sequence[str] | None) – Optional ordering for the first component of the combined group name.

  • cluster_to_cell_mapping (Mapping[str, str] | None) – Optional mapping from cluster IDs to cell type labels for the legend.

  • legend_location (str) – Where to place legends ("on_data", "right", or "none").

  • point_size (float | None) – Optional marker size. If None, a size proportional to the total cell count is used.

scoriapy.pl.plot_umap_by_group(adata, group_column, **kwargs)

Plot UMAPs for each unique value in group_column.

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object with a computed UMAP embedding.

  • group_column (str) – Column in adata.obs whose unique values define subplots.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments forwarded to scanpy.pl.umap().

scoriapy.pl.plot_umap_grid_by_sample(adata, col_per_row=2, figsize_per_plot=(4, 4))

Plot a grid of UMAPs, one per sample in adata.obs['sample_name'].

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object with a UMAP embedding.

  • col_per_row (int) – Number of UMAP subplots per row.

  • figsize_per_plot (tuple[int, int]) – Size of each individual UMAP subplot.

Returns:

Figure containing the UMAP grid.

Return type:

matplotlib.figure.Figure

scoriapy.pl.plot_umap_param_grid(adata, min_dists=(0.1, 1, 2), spreads=(0.5, 1, 5))

Plot a grid of UMAPs for all combinations of min_dist and spread.

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object with precomputed neighbors/PCA, ready for UMAP.

  • min_dists (Sequence[float]) – Sequence of min_dist values to evaluate.

  • spreads (Sequence[float]) – Sequence of spread values to evaluate.

scoriapy.pl.plot_violin_genes(adata1, adata2, common_genes, group_col_adata1, group_col_adata2, subplot_width=2)

Plot violin plots for genes across specified groups from two AnnData objects.

Parameters:

  • adata1 – First AnnData object.

  • adata2 – Second AnnData object.

  • common_genes (List[str]) – List of genes to visualize.

  • group_col_adata1 (str) – Grouping column in adata1.obs.

  • group_col_adata2 (str) – Grouping column in adata2.obs.

  • subplot_width (float) – Width of each subplot in inches.

scoriapy.pl.sort_cells_by_metadata(adata, primary_sort_col, primary_categories, second_sort_col, second_categories)

Sort cells by two categorical obs columns.

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – AnnData object to sort.

  • primary_sort_col (str) – Name of the primary categorical column (e.g. "age").

  • primary_categories (List[str]) – Desired ordering of categories in primary_sort_col.

  • second_sort_col (str) – Name of the secondary categorical column.

  • second_categories (List[str]) – Desired ordering of categories in second_sort_col.

Returns:

AnnData object reordered according to the sorted index.

Return type:

AnnData

scoriapy.pl.subset_adata(adata, group_col, keys, genes_map)

Subset AnnData by selected groups and genes, assigning gene categories.

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – AnnData object with a populated raw attribute.

  • group_col (str) – Column in adata.obs used to select cells.

  • keys (List[str]) – Values in group_col that define the subset of cells.

  • genes_map (Dict[str, str]) – Mapping from gene name to category label. Only genes present in adata.raw.var_names are used.

Returns:

Subsetted AnnData with selected genes and cells; gene categories are stored in .var['gene_cat'].

Return type:

AnnData

Utilities (scoriapy.utils)

scoriapy.utils.confirm_and_set_colors(adata, color_attribute, color_map)

Interactively confirm and apply a color map for a categorical obs column.

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object.

  • color_attribute (str) – Column in adata.obs used for coloring.

  • color_map (Dict[str, str]) – Mapping from category to color code.

scoriapy.utils.create_cell_mask(adata, conditions)

Create a boolean mask for cells based on multiple flexible conditions.

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – The AnnData object.

  • conditions (dict) –

    A mapping of obs column name to a condition. The condition can be:

    • a single value (str, int, float)

    • a list/tuple/array/Series of allowed values

    • a callable that takes a Series and returns a boolean Series

Returns:

Boolean mask over observations.

Return type:

np.ndarray

scoriapy.utils.display_colors(color_list)

Display colors as inline blocks in a notebook.

Parameters:

color_list – Iterable of color specifications (e.g. hex strings) to display.

scoriapy.utils.display_colors_with_keys(color_map)

Display a mapping of keys to colors as inline blocks in a notebook.

Parameters:

color_map (Dict[str, str]) – Mapping from label to color code to visualize.

scoriapy.utils.extract_cell_cluster(adata, col_obs, keys)

Extract a subset of cells from an AnnData object based on values in .obs.

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – AnnData object.

  • col_obs (str) – Column in adata.obs used for filtering.

  • keys – Single key or list of keys to keep.

Returns:

Subsetted AnnData or None if no cells match.

Return type:

AnnData or None

scoriapy.utils.get_full_df(adata, keys=None, scale=True)

Extract expression data from adata.raw and optionally z-score scale it.

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – AnnData object.

  • keys (list[str] | None) – Variable names to extract. If None, all variables are used.

  • scale (bool) – If True, apply z-score column-wise.

Returns:

Expression matrix (optionally scaled).

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

scoriapy.utils.get_mat_df(adata, keys=None, use_raw=True)

Extract expression data as a DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – AnnData object.

  • keys (list[str] | None) – Variable names to extract. If None, all variables are used.

  • use_raw (bool) – If True, use adata.raw; otherwise use adata.X.

Returns:

Expression matrix with observations as rows.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

scoriapy.utils.make_annotation_df(adata_dict)

Combine metadata from multiple AnnData objects into a single DataFrame.

Currently expects keys "age" and "rapa" and normalizes the column name to "group".

Parameters:

adata_dict (dict)

Return type:

DataFrame

scoriapy.utils.make_mat_dfs(adata_dict, common_genes)

Extract scaled expression matrices for a list of common genes.

Parameters:

  • adata_dict (dict) – Mapping of dataset name to AnnData.

  • common_genes (list[str]) – Genes to extract.

Returns:

Mapping from dataset name to a transposed expression DataFrame.

Return type:

dict

scoriapy.utils.map_colors(reference_dict, target_dict, mapping_dict)

Map colors from a reference dictionary to a target dictionary.

Parameters:

  • reference_dict (Dict[str, str]) – Mapping from reference category to color (e.g. cluster ID → hex code).

  • target_dict (Dict[str, str]) – Mapping whose keys define the target categories to color. Existing values are ignored; only the keys are used.

  • mapping_dict (Dict[str, Iterable[str]]) – Mapping from reference keys to iterable(s) of target keys. Each target key inherits the color of its reference key.

Returns:

New mapping from target keys to colors. Keys not specified in mapping_dict are assigned gray ("#808080").

Return type:

dict

scoriapy.utils.scale_df(df)

Apply z-score normalization to each column of a DataFrame.

Parameters:

df (DataFrame) – Input DataFrame.

Returns:

DataFrame with standardized columns (mean=0, std=1).

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

scoriapy.utils.setup_logger(log_file=None, level=20)

Create and configure the shared "scoriapy" logger.

The logger is configured only once; subsequent calls reuse the same instance without adding duplicate handlers. By default, log messages are written to stderr; if log_file is provided, they are also written to a file.

Parameters:

  • log_file (str | None) – Optional path to a log file. If given, a FileHandler is added in addition to the standard stream handler.

  • level – Logging level to use (e.g. logging.INFO).

Returns:

Configured logger instance named "scoriapy".

Return type:

logging.Logger

scoriapy.utils.subset_adata_by_mask(adata, cell_mask, gene_list, use_raw=True)

Subset an AnnData object using a cell mask and gene list.

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – The original AnnData object.

  • cell_mask (ndarray) – Boolean mask for selecting cells.

  • gene_list (list) – Genes to keep.

  • use_raw (bool) – Whether to use adata.raw for gene subsetting.

Returns:

A new subsetted AnnData object.

Return type:

AnnData

scoriapy.utils.subset_by_markers(adata, markers, strategy='any', threshold=0.0, require_n_markers=1, min_count=1, use_raw=False, add_obs_key=None)

Subset cells based on expression of a set of marker genes.

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object containing the expression matrix.

  • markers (List[str]) – List of marker gene names. Genes not found in adata.var_names are silently ignored.

  • strategy (Literal['any', 'all', 'count', 'threshold']) –

    Strategy used to define positive cells:

    • "any" – keep cells expressing any marker above threshold.

    • "all" – keep cells expressing all markers above threshold.

    • "count" – keep cells with at least min_count markers above threshold.

    • "threshold" – keep cells whose mean marker expression exceeds threshold.

  • threshold (float) – Expression cutoff to consider a marker as expressed.

  • require_n_markers (int) – Minimum number of markers required to be present in adata.var_names. Currently this is advisory only and does not alter behaviour, but can be used by callers for validation.

  • min_count (int) – Minimum number of expressed markers when strategy='count'.

  • use_raw (bool) – If True and adata.raw is present, use adata.raw.X instead of adata.X.

  • add_obs_key (str | None) – Optional name of an obs column to store the boolean mask.

Returns:

Copy of adata restricted to cells that satisfy the marker rule.

Return type:
